timeline.message:
GH-1484: Minimal RDF* model and parser/writers for Turtle* and TriG*

Signed-off-by: Pavel Mihaylov <pavel@ontotext.com>

GH-1484: Changed SPARQLUpdateDataBlockParser to use TriGStar instead of TriG to support future RDF* data blocks

Signed-off-by: Pavel Mihaylov <pavel@ontotext.com>

GH-1484: RDF* <-> RDF reification conversion utility classes and RDF* -> RDF reification support in RDF serializers

Signed-off-by: Pavel Mihaylov <pavel@ontotext.com>

GH-1484: RDF* triple support in the HTTP protocol (via NTriplesUtil) and RDF* triple support in the binary RDF result format

Signed-off-by: Pavel Mihaylov <pavel@ontotext.com>

SPARQL grammar update to support SPARQL*

Signed-off-by: damyan.ognyanov <damyan.ognyanov@ontotext.com>

GH-1484: RDF* serialization for Binary query results (extended existing format) and two new formats, SPARQL* JSON and SPARQL* TSV

 - RDF* compatibility serialization (as IRIs) for all RDF formats
 - Added another MIME type for Turtle* to better reflect its Turtle origin
 - Parser/writer (both RDF and query result) cleanup and contract enforcement, improved tests
 - NTriplesUtil moved outside NTriples module (similar to some other NTriples related classes used in multiple places)
 - Moved Turtle* and TriG* to Turtle and TriG modules instead of separate modules
 - Compare Triple in ValueComparator

Signed-off-by: Pavel Mihaylov <pavel@ontotext.com>

GH-1484: RDF* serialization for Binary query results (extended existing format) and two new formats, SPARQL* JSON and SPARQL* TSV

 - RDF* compatibility serialization (as IRIs) for all RDF formats
 - Added another MIME type for Turtle* to better reflect its Turtle origin
 - Parser/writer (both RDF and query result) cleanup and contract enforcement, improved tests
 - NTriplesUtil moved outside NTriples module (similar to some other NTriples related classes used in multiple places)
 - Moved Turtle* and TriG* to Turtle and TriG modules instead of separate modules
 - Compare Triple in ValueComparator

Signed-off-by: Pavel Mihaylov <pavel@ontotext.com>

GH-1484 clean up handling of writingStarted check in AbstractRDFWriter

- writingStarted now a private boolean field
- renamed handleStatementImpl to consumeStatement
- made consumeStatement concrete no-op method to provide backward
  compatibility

Signed-off-by: Jeen Broekstra <jeen.broekstra@gmail.com>

GH-1484 clean up handling of writingStarted check in AbstractRDFWriter

- writingStarted now a private boolean field
- renamed handleStatementImpl to consumeStatement
- made consumeStatement concrete no-op method to provide backward
  compatibility

Signed-off-by: Jeen Broekstra <jeen.broekstra@gmail.com>

GH-1484 clean up handling of writingStarted check in AbstractRDFWriter

- writingStarted now a private boolean field
- renamed handleStatementImpl to consumeStatement
- made consumeStatement concrete no-op method to provide backward
  compatibility

Signed-off-by: Jeen Broekstra <jeen.broekstra@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: Could be use the new DynamicModel here?
timeline.author: hmottestad
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -753,4 +758,152 @@ private static Model toModel(Iterable iterable) { public static Model synchronizedModel(Model toSynchronize) { return new SynchronizedModel(toSynchronize); } + + /** + * Converts the supplied RDF* model to RDF reification statements. The converted statements are sent to the supplied + * consumer function. + *

+ * The supplied value factory is used to create all new statements. + * + * @param vf the {@link ValueFactory} to use for creating statements. + * @param model the {@link Model} to convert. + * @param consumer the {@link Consumer} function for the produced statements. + */ + public static void convertRDFStarToReification(ValueFactory vf, Model model, Consumer consumer) { + model.forEach(st -> Statements.convertRDFStarToReification(vf, st, consumer)); + } + + /** + * Converts the supplied RDF* model to RDF reification statements. The converted statements are sent to the supplied + * consumer function. + * + * @param model the {@link Model} to convert. + * @param consumer the {@link Consumer} function for the produced statements. + */ + public static void convertRDFStarToReification(Model model, Consumer consumer) { + convertRDFStarToReification(SimpleValueFactory.getInstance(), model, consumer); + } + + /** + * Converts the supplied RDF* model to an RDF reification model. + *

+ * The supplied value factory is used to create all new statements. + * + * @param vf the {@link ValueFactory} to use for creating statements. + * @param model the {@link Model} to convert. + * @return the converted {@link Model}. + */ + public static Model convertRDFStarToReification(ValueFactory vf, Model model) { + Model reificationModel = new LinkedHashModel();

replies.bodyText: I'll have a look, and perhaps also create an overload that accepts a ModelFactory.
replies.author: jeenbroekstra

timeline.bodyText: This kind of use of .filter(....) shows that we really need a .select(...) instead. I think .filter(....) is too heavyweight with all its guarantees about returning a model that reflects the underlying model...while all we really need here is at iterator.
timeline.author: hmottestad

replies.bodyText: I think it might be faster to have a java switch over model.filter(s.getSubject(), null, null) instead of doing a model.filter for each.
replies.author: hmottestad

replies.bodyText:
This kind of use of .filter(....) shows that we really need a .select(...) instead. I think .filter(....) is too heavyweight with all its guarantees about returning a model that reflects the underlying model...while all we really need here is at iterator.

Agreed. Issue logged: #2030
replies.author: jeenbroekstra

timeline.author: hmottestad

timeline.bodyText: Does this risk bnode identifiers being really long of the Triple contains a long literal?
timeline.author: hmottestad
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -26,6 +31,16 @@
  */
 public class Statements {
 
+	/**
+	 * A {@link Function} that maps {@link Triple} to {@link org.eclipse.rdf4j.model.BNode} consistently. Multiple
+	 * invocations for the same {@link Triple} will return the same {@link org.eclipse.rdf4j.model.BNode}.
+	 *
+	 * The current implementation creates a {@link org.eclipse.rdf4j.model.BNode} by encoding the string representation
+	 * of the {@link Triple} using base64 URL-safe encoding.
+	 */
+	public static Function<Triple, Resource> TRIPLE_BNODE_MAPPER = (t) -> SimpleValueFactory.getInstance()
+			.createBNode(Base64.getUrlEncoder().encodeToString(t.stringValue().getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8)));
+

replies.bodyText: I don't see that as a major issue, but if it becomes a problem we could switch to using a fixed-length message digest hash (MD5) as an alternative. I'd suggest it's YAGNI for now though.
replies.author: jeenbroekstra

replies.bodyText: Would collisions be an issue then?
replies.author: hmottestad

replies.bodyText: IIRC collision risk of MD5 is 1:2^128. For our purposes safe enough I'd say.
replies.author: jeenbroekstra

timeline.bodyText: I believe you can use .equals on models and it uses isomorphic underneath.
timeline.author: hmottestad

replies.bodyText:
I believe you can use .equals on models and it uses isomorphic underneath.

It does but I've just checked and we don't actually specify this in the API, as far as I can tell. So I'll leave this explicit for now.
replies.author: jeenbroekstra

timeline.author: hmottestad
hmottestad

timeline.bodyText: @jeenbroekstra why do we have two ValueComapartors?
timeline.author: hmottestad

replies.bodyText:
@jeenbroekstra why do we have two ValueComapartors?

I'm probably overlooking something. What other one besides this class do you see?
replies.author: jeenbroekstra

replies.bodyText: Never mind, my fault. I had mistaken the LexicalValueComparator for being SPARQL compliant.
replies.author: hmottestad

timeline.message:
GH-1484 ModelFactory injection and javadoc improvements

- marked utility functions as Experimental
- added method overloads to allow ModelFactory injection
- use DynamicModel as default implementation
- editoral changes to javadoc
